content:
SslSecurityTokenParameters Class

Definition

Represents the parameters for an SSL security token that is obtained when doing the SOAP-level SSL protocol with the server.

In this Article

public class SslSecurityTokenParameters : System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters
Inheritance
Object
SecurityTokenParameters
SslSecurityTokenParameters

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
Clone()
InclusionMode
MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken, SecurityKeyIdentifierClause, SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)
ReferenceStyle
RequireDerivedKeys

Remarks

This class is a collection of token properties and methods, and is used in creating security binding elements and tokens.

Constructors

SslSecurityTokenParameters()

Initializes a new instance of the SslSecurityTokenParameters class.

public SslSecurityTokenParameters ();

Remarks

The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

  • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

  • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

  • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

SslSecurityTokenParameters(Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the SslSecurityTokenParameters class.

public SslSecurityTokenParameters (bool requireClientCertificate);
Parameters
requireClientCertificate
Boolean

true to require client certificate; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

  • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

  • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

  • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

RequireCancellation is set to false.

RequireClientCertificate is set to requireClientCertificate.

SslSecurityTokenParameters(SslSecurityTokenParameters)

Initializes a new instance of the SslSecurityTokenParameters class from another instance.

protected SslSecurityTokenParameters (System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SslSecurityTokenParameters other);
Parameters
other
SslSecurityTokenParameters

The other instance of this class.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

other is null.

Remarks

The new instance property values are set to the corresponding values in other.

SslSecurityTokenParameters(Boolean, Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the SslSecurityTokenParameters class.

public SslSecurityTokenParameters (bool requireClientCertificate, bool requireCancellation);
Parameters
requireClientCertificate
Boolean

true to require client certificate; otherwise, false.

requireCancellation
Boolean

true to require cancellation; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

  • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

  • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

  • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

RequireCancellation is set to requireCancellation.

RequireClientCertificate is set to requireClientCertificate.

Properties

HasAsymmetricKey

Gets a value that indicates whether the token has an asymmetric key.

protected override bool HasAsymmetricKey { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the token has an asymmetric key; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property always returns false.

Asymmetric keys are used in public-key cryptography, which uses two keys, a public key and a private key, which are related mathematically. The public key is distributed widely, but the private key is kept secret. In public-key cryptography, there is no need to exchange a common key.

RequireCancellation

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether cancellation is required.

public bool RequireCancellation { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if cancellation is required; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If cancellation is required, then the security context token issued at the end of the SSL protocol is session based; otherwise, it is cookie based.

RequireClientCertificate

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a client certificate is required.

public bool RequireClientCertificate { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if a client certificate is required; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsClientAuthentication

When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.

protected override bool SupportsClientAuthentication { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the token supports client authentication; otherwise, false.

SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.

protected override bool SupportsClientWindowsIdentity { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the token supports a Windows identity for authentication; otherwise, false.

SupportsServerAuthentication

When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.

protected override bool SupportsServerAuthentication { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the token supports server authentication; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property always returns false.

Methods

CloneCore()

Clones another instance of this instance of the class.

protected override System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters CloneCore ();
Returns
SecurityTokenParameters

A SecurityTokenParameters instance that represents the copy.

Remarks

The Clone and CloneCore methods follow the Core design pattern. CloneCore overrides CloneCore.

The CloneCore method calls the SslSecurityTokenParameters constructor.

CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken, SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

Creates a key identifier clause for a token.

protected override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause CreateKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token, System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenReferenceStyle referenceStyle);
Parameters
token
SecurityToken

The token.

referenceStyle
SecurityTokenReferenceStyle

The reference style of the security token.

Returns
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

The key identifier clause for a token.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

token is null.

NotSupportedException

referenceStyle is not External or Internal.

Remarks

This method creates a key identifier clause using the CreateKeyIdentifierClause method, with referenceStyle as a generic parameter.

InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

Initializes a security token requirement.

protected override void InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement requirement);
Parameters
requirement
SecurityTokenRequirement

The requirement of the security token.

Remarks

The following properties of the SecurityTokenRequirement are initialized:

  • If RequireClientCertificate is true, TokenType = MutualSslnego; otherwise, it is set to AnonymousSslnego.

  • RequireCryptographicToken = true.

  • The SupportSecurityContextCancellation property in Properties is set to RequireCancellation.

  • The IssuedSecurityTokenParameters property in Properties is set to a clone of the current instance.

  • KeyType = SecurityKeyType.

ToString()

Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A text representation of this instance of the class.

Remarks

The method displays the name of this class, RequireCancellation, and RequireClientCertificate.
